spirit:addressBlock.spirit:name: some_register_map
spirit:addressBlock.spirit:description: This address map contains some example registers to show how RDL can be utilized in various situations.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSPIDL24
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the state of the marvell msa core (not marvell msa subsystem). the availability of the marvell msa subsystem memories and peripheral bus to the marvell seagull/mohawk core is still governed by means of mpcrx[dspsd], and is not reflected by this bit. 0 = marvell msa core is currently not in idle state 1 = marvell msa core is currently in idle state

spirit:field.spirit:name: AP_IDLE25
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the state of the marvell mohawk core. 0x1= core is in external idle or power off mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SG_IDLE26
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 = <var processor: comm> is idle 0 = <var processor: comm> is active

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSPAVL27
spirit:field.spirit:description: marvell msa subsystem availability indication. this field should be read after mpcrx[dspsd] is deasserted, to verify the clock is resumed 0 = marvell msa subsystem clock is not running 1 = marvell msa subsystem clock is running

spirit:field.spirit:name: AP_WFI28
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the state of the marvell mohawk core. 0 = marvell mohawk core is currently not in wfi state 1 = marvell mohawk core is currently in wfi state

spirit:field.spirit:name: SG_WFI29
spirit:field.spirit:description: seagull wfi flag. it reflects the wfi flag that is directly output from seagull. when seagull enters wfi, this field will be set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: APOFF30
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the power state of the marvell mohawk core. 1 = core is currently in power-off mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_COMM_TOP_D231
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the power state of comm_top 1 = comm_top is in d2 mode. in this mode, msa/seagull are powered off

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_COMM_TOP_STATE33
spirit:field.spirit:description: comm_top low power state 0x8=comm_top is in d0 state 0xb=comm_top is in d2 state

spirit:field.spirit:name: I2SCLKSEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: i<super 2>s divider clock selection 1 = from vctcxo 0 = from 312 mhz clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL1FBD44
spirit:field.spirit:description: actually this register bits are not used in auiqla, it's fixed to 0x30 now.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FORCE
spirit:field.spirit:description: force all clocks to be free running 0 = this field does not affect clock gating 1 = all output clocks are never gated

spirit:field.spirit:name: VCXOST
spirit:field.spirit:description: determines the wait time for vctcxo and clock limiter stabilization. referred to as d1 in table 36. 0x0 = wait time = one 32.768 khz clock cycle 0x1 = wait time = two 32.768 khz clock cycles \xc9 0xe5 wait time = 230 32.768 khz clock cycles 0xe6 reserved \xc9 0xff reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: WAITPLLLOCKTIMEVALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: determines the wait time for pll lock. referred to as d2 in table 36. this value determines lock time for both plls (pll1 and pll2). 0x0 = main pll lock time = 1 vctcxo/2 cycle 0x1 = main pll lock time = 2 vctcxo/2 cycles \xc9 0xfff main pll lock time = 4096 vctcxo/2 cycles

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_PLL1_LOCK63
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1: pll1 is locked

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL2REFD
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll2 refdiv decoding -tbd

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL2FBD
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll2 fbdiv decoding - tbd

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL1FBD67
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll1 fbdiv decoding - tbd

spirit:register.spirit:name: SUCCR
spirit:register.spirit:description: Slow UART (UART 1) Clock Generation Control Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: UARTDIVN
spirit:field.spirit:description: uart clock generation programmable divider numerator value. the uart clock is generated using a fractional divider. see section 1.5.2.3, slow uart clock divider programming, on page 73 for calculating the required values. this divider configuration is common to all uart modules

spirit:field.spirit:name: UARTDIVD
spirit:field.spirit:description: uart clock generation programmable divider denominator value. the uart clock is generated using a fractional divider. see section 1.5.2.3, slow uart clock divider programming, on page 73 for calculating the required values. this divider configuration is common to all uart modules

spirit:field.spirit:name: SW_REQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: sw request of vctcxo

spirit:field.spirit:name: REQ_POL2
spirit:field.spirit:description: vcxo_req2 request polarity

spirit:field.spirit:name: REQ_POL1
spirit:field.spirit:description: vcxo_req1 request polarity

spirit:field.spirit:name: REQ_POL0
spirit:field.spirit:description: vcxo_req request polarity

spirit:field.spirit:name: REQ_EN2
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable vcxo_req2 for vcxo_out2

spirit:field.spirit:name: REQ_EN1
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable vcxo_req1 for vcxo_out1

spirit:field.spirit:name: REQ_EN0
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable vcxo_req for vcxo_out

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL3SSC_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: spectrum spread mode 00: center-spread 01: up-spread 10: down-spread 11: down-spread

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SSC_FORCE_LOCK100
spirit:field.spirit:description: set pll force lock 0: disable 1: enable, when reg3<4>=0, set force lock to pll_lk signal

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SPRD_DEP_STEP101
spirit:field.spirit:description: increase spectrum spread depth by 2 0: disable 1: spread depth x2

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL3_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll3 power on 0 = pll off 1 = pll on; pll3 is automatically off whenever pll is off.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL3_FBDIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll3 fbdiv

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL3_FRCDIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll3 frcdiv

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SWR116
spirit:field.spirit:description: software controlled, reset events tracking field. this field may be written (and read) to any value between 0x0 and 0xf. this field's content does not affect functionality in any way

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_WDTR118
spirit:field.spirit:description: indicates whether the last system reset was caused by a watchdog timer reset event 0 = last system reset was not caused by watchdog timer reset 1 = last system reset was caused by watchdog timer reset depending on the type of reset the device has experienced, one of the reset values in [2:0] is 1 and the others are 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_EMR119
spirit:field.spirit:description: indicates whether the last system reset was caused by an external master reset event 0 = last system reset was not caused by external master reset 1 = last system reset was caused by external master reset depending on the type of reset the device has experienced, one of the reset values in [2:0] is 1 and the others are 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_POR120
spirit:field.spirit:description: indicates whether the last system reset was caused by a power on reset event 0 = last system reset was not caused by power on reset 1 = last system reset was caused by power on reset depending on the type of reset the device has experienced, one of the reset values in [2:0] is 1 and the others are 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: XDCR_TIE4
spirit:field.spirit:description: pmost_cnt_done (pmose to drowsy)

spirit:field.spirit:name: XDCR_TO2
spirit:field.spirit:description: firewall_cnt2-done (from firewall to prefirewall2)

spirit:field.spirit:name: XDCR_TO1
spirit:field.spirit:description: nmos_cnt2_done (from nmos2 to firewall)

spirit:register.spirit:name: GPCR
spirit:register.spirit:description: General Purpose Clock Generation Control Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: GPCDIVN
spirit:field.spirit:description: general purpose clock generation programmable divider numerator value. this clock is generated using a fractional divider, off the vctcxo clock. see section 1.5.2.3, slow uart clock divider programming, on page 73 for examples of calculating the programmed values.

spirit:field.spirit:name: GPCDIVD
spirit:field.spirit:description: general purpose clock generation programmable divider denominator value. this clock is generated using a fractional divider, off the vctcxo clock. see section 1.5.2.3, slow uart clock divider programming, on page 73 for examples of calculating the programmed values.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL2SSC_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: spectrum spread mode 00: center-spread 01: up-spread 10: down-spread 11: down-spread

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SSC_FORCE_LOCK145
spirit:field.spirit:description: set pll force lock 0: disable 1: enable, when reg3<4>=0, set force lock to pll_lk signal

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SPRD_DEP_STEP146
spirit:field.spirit:description: increase spectrum spread depth by 2 0: disable 1: spread depth x2

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL2_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll2 power on 0 = pll2 off 1 = pll2 on; pll3 is automatically off whenever pll1 is off.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL2_FBDIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll2 fbdiv

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL2_FRCDIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll2 frcdiv

spirit:field.spirit:name: BB_F_SLP_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: force modem into sleep mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: AFE_CLK_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: afe calibration clock (26 mhz vcxo) enable 0 = disable 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: SCS
spirit:field.spirit:description: slow clock select: 0 = 32khz internal clock is derived from vctcxo divider 1 = 32khz internal clock uses 32khz clock input

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SYSCLK_EN169
spirit:field.spirit:description: enables the i2s clock input to sysclkn generator as well as the output of the generator.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SYSCLK_BASE170
spirit:field.spirit:description: selects the i2s m/n divider input clock frequency: 0 = sysclkn generator base clock rate is 26 mhz 1 = sysclkn generator base clock rate is 156 mhz.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_BITCLK_EN171
spirit:field.spirit:description: enables the i2s clock input to the bit clock generator.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_BITCLK_DIV_468172
spirit:field.spirit:description: determine bitclk1:sysclk1 relation: 0x0 = reserved 0x1 = bitclk1 rate is the sysclk1 rate divide by 4 0x2 = bitclk1 rate is the sysclk1 rate divide by 6 0x3 = bitclk1 rate is the sysclk1 rate divide by 8

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DENOM173
spirit:field.spirit:description: i2s clock generation programmable divider denominator value. the i2s sysclk is generated using a fractional divider. see section 1.5.2.4, i2s clock divider programming, on page 74 for calculating the required values.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_NOM174
spirit:field.spirit:description: i2s clock generation programmable divider numerator value. the i2s sysclk is generated using a fractional divider. see section 1.5.2.4, i2s clock divider programming, on page 74 for calculating the required values.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL5SSC_MODE181
spirit:field.spirit:description: spectrum spread mode 00: center-spread 01: up-spread 10: down-spread 11: down-spread

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SSC_FORCE_LOCK182
spirit:field.spirit:description: set pll force lock 0: disable 1: enable, when reg3<4>=0, set force lock to pll_lk signal

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SPRD_DEP_STEP183
spirit:field.spirit:description: increase spectrum spread depth by 2 0: disable 1: spread depth x2

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL5_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll5 power on 0 = pll5 off 1 = pll on; pll5 is automatically off whenever pll is off.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL5_FBDIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll5 fbdiv

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL5_FRCDIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll5 frcdiv

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL5SSC_MODE196
spirit:field.spirit:description: spectrum spread mode 00: center-spread 01: up-spread 10: down-spread 11: down-spread

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SSC_FORCE_LOCK197
spirit:field.spirit:description: set pll force lock 0: disable 1: enable, when reg3<4>=0, set force lock to pll_lk signal

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SPRD_DEP_STEP198
spirit:field.spirit:description: increase spectrum spread depth by 2 0: disable 1: spread depth x2

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL4_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll4 power on 0 = pll off 1 = pll on; pll4 is automatically off whenever pll4 is off.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL4_FBDIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll4 fbdiv

spirit:field.spirit:name: PLL4_FRCDIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: pll4 frcdiv

spirit:register.spirit:name: FCAP
spirit:register.spirit:description: <var Processor: Application> Core Frequency Change Control Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: C2_PLLSEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: application> cluster2 core clock selection 0x0 = pll1 1248 mhz 0x1 = pll1 832 mhz 0x2= pll3_div2(1.05g) 0x3=pll2_div2 0x4=pll5_div1 0x5=pll6_div1 0x6=pll4_div1(1.75g) 0x7=pll3_div1(2.1g)

spirit:field.spirit:name: C1_PLLSEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: application> cluster1 core clock selection 0x0 = pll1 1248 mhz 0x1 = pll1 832 mhz 0x2= pll3_div2(1.05g) 0x3=pll2_div2 0x4=pll5_div1 0x5=pll6_div1 0x6=pll4_div1(1.75g) 0x7 = reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: C0_PLLSEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: application> cluster0 core clock selection 0x0 = pll1 624 mhz 0x1 = pll1 832 mhz 0x2= pll1 499mhz 0x3 = pll3_div2(1.05g) 0x4 = pll1 1248mhz 0x5~0x7 reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DCLKSEL225
spirit:field.spirit:description: ddr clock selection 7=pll3 div2 6=pll5 div2 0x5 = pll4 div2 0x4 = pll2 div2 0x3 = pll6_div1 0x2 = pll2 div1 0x1= pll1 832 mhz 0x0 = pll1 624 mhz

spirit:field.spirit:name: ACLKSEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: axi clock selection 0x0 = pll1 416 mhz 0x1 = pll1 312 mhz

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPCTL
spirit:field.spirit:description: test points control mux select. this field determines whether the test points mux is controlled by tunit, by means of pm_ext_tpsel input port or by means of tpsel field of this register 0 = test points mux control is by means of pm_ext_tpsel input bus 1 = test points mux control is by means of dsoc[tpsel] field

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPSEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: test points mux select - each combination of these bits will yield a different set of signals driven on the cw_bus_out output bus. detailed description of these signals may be found in the mas

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_FNCLKSEL253
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0x0 = 13 mhz clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_RST255
spirit:field.spirit:description: timers h/w reset generation (resets both apb & functional domains) 0 = no reset 1 = reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_FNCLK256
spirit:field.spirit:description: timers + wdtfunctional clock enable/disable 0 = clock off 1 = clock on

spirit:field.spirit:name: ABCLK
spirit:field.spirit:description: cp timers and wdt apb bus clock enable/disable 0 = clock off 1 = clock on

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_RST265
spirit:field.spirit:description: r-ipc h/w reset generation ) 0 = no reset 1 = reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_APBCLK267
spirit:field.spirit:description: r-ipc apb bus clock enable/disable 0 = clock off 1 = clock on

spirit:field.spirit:name: DBG_CP_AXI_ACCESS_MSK
spirit:field.spirit:description: debug used. mask communicon processor axi request. 0= not mask. 1= mask.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DBG_CP_DDR_ACCESS_MSK
spirit:field.spirit:description: debug used. mask communicon processor ddr request. 0= not mask. 1= mask.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_INTCLR285
spirit:field.spirit:description: interrupt clear register. a write of 1 followed by a write of 0 to this field clears the pm_moh_wakeup_int output of . the read value is the last value written to this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPWP0286
spirit:field.spirit:description: sleep mode wake-up decoder port 0 disable 0 = wake-up port 0 is enabled 1 = wake-up port 0 is disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPWP1287
spirit:field.spirit:description: sleep mode wake-up decoder port 1 disable 0 = wake-up port 1 is enabled 1 = wake-up port 1 is disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPWP2288
spirit:field.spirit:description: sleep mode wake-up decoder port 2 disable 0 = wake-up port 2 is enabled 1 = wake-up port 2 is disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPWP3289
spirit:field.spirit:description: sleep mode wake-up decoder port 3 disable 0 = wake-up port 3 is enabled 1 = wake-up port 3 is disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPWP4291
spirit:field.spirit:description: sleep mode wake-up decoder port 4 disable 0 = wake-up port 4 is enabled 1 = wake-up port 4 is disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPWP5292
spirit:field.spirit:description: sleep mode wake-up decoder port 5 disable 0 = wake-up port 5 is enabled 1 = wake-up port 5 is disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPWP6293
spirit:field.spirit:description: sleep mode wake-up decoder port 6 disable 0 = wake-up port 6 is enabled 1 = wake-up port 6 is disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPWP7294
spirit:field.spirit:description: sleep mode wake-up decoder port 7 disable 0 = wake-up port 7 is enabled 1 = wake-up port 7 is disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSPIDL303
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the state of the marvell msa core (not marvell msa subsystem). the availability of the marvell msa subsystem memories and peripheral bus to the marvell seagull/mohawk core is still governed by means of mpcrx[dspsd], and is not reflected by this bit. 0 = marvell msa core is currently not in idle state 1 = marvell msa core is currently in idle state

spirit:field.spirit:name: AP_IDLE304
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the state of the marvell mohawk core. 0x1= core is in external idle or power off mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SG_IDLE305
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 = <var processor: comm> is idle 0 = <var processor: comm> is active

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSPAVL306
spirit:field.spirit:description: marvell msa subsystem availability indication. this field should be read after mpcrx[dspsd] is deasserted, to verify the clock is resumed 0 = marvell msa subsystem clock is not running 1 = marvell msa subsystem clock is running

spirit:field.spirit:name: AP_WFI307
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the state of the marvell mohawk core. 0 = marvell mohawk core is currently not in wfi state 1 = marvell mohawk core is currently in wfi state

spirit:field.spirit:name: SG_WFI308
spirit:field.spirit:description: seagull wfi flag. it reflects the wfi flag that is directly output from seagull. when seagull enters wfi, this field will be set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: APOFF309
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the power state of the marvell mohawk core. 1 = core is currently in power-off mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_COMM_TOP_D2310
spirit:field.spirit:description: reflects the power state of comm_top 1 = comm_top is in d2 mode. in this mode, msa/seagull are powered off

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_COMM_TOP_STATE312
spirit:field.spirit:description: comm_top low power state 0x8=comm_top is in d0 state 0xb=comm_top is in d2 state

spirit:field.spirit:name: SGR_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: communication processor reset mode select. 1=direct mode. set cpr will reset communication processor immediately. 0=silent reset mode. set cpr will not reset communication processor immediately. only when all communication processor memory and register request finished, communication processor can be reseted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SGR_RST
spirit:field.spirit:description: communication processor reset status. 1= communication processor at reset state. 0=communication at active state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SIRST_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: communication processor silent reset wait time this field determines the wait time for the completion of a silent reset to communication processor. when the wait counter has reached this value, silrst is set to 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RST_DONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: reset done flag. this bit is set when sirst_cnt counter to 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLAVE_R324
spirit:field.spirit:description: slave_reset_out pin sw reset control 1 = slave_reset_out is low. 0 = slave_reset_out may be high base on reset_in and wdt reset.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSRAMINT325
spirit:field.spirit:description: this signal hold the msa from start execution after released from reset. it will be used to hold msa from start execution till his boot address in sram will be initial with valid code. 1 = execution is hold 0 = msa is running

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_WDTR326
spirit:field.spirit:description: negate hardware reset to the wdt after system reset. this field is reset due to a wdt reset event reading 0 = wdt reset is still asserted from the last system reset reading 1 = wdt reset is negated writing 0 = operation is ignored writing 1 = negates the wdt reset the actual release of the wdt reset signal might be delayed by up to 11/2 cycles of the 32.768 khz clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_BBR327
spirit:field.spirit:description: apply global hardware reset to the baseband logic 0 = hardware reset is negated 1 = hardware reset is asserted the baseband logic reset is effected also from dprr register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSPR328
spirit:field.spirit:description: apply global hardware reset to the whole marvell msa subsystem. 0 = hardware reset is negated 1 = hardware reset is asserted

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_APR329
spirit:field.spirit:description: this is read only bit - cp_wf_fuse 0 = mohawk core was the second core to boot 1 = mohawk core was the first core to boot.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CPR330
spirit:field.spirit:description: apply hardware reset to the communication processor (seagull core). 1 = core is hold in reset. 0 = core is released from reset the initial value of this bit is determined by cp_wf_fuse_not cp_wf_fuse = 1 (seagull core is the first one to boot). cp_wf_fose not is 0 when seagull wakeup first

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_WDT_13M339
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 13 mhz clock output of the main to the watchdogtimer. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_1248M341
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 1248 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_624M342
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 624 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_832M343
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 832 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_312M344
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 312 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_104M345
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 104 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_52M346
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 52 mhz clock output for ap pmu and ap perihrals. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_48M347
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 48 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_GPC348
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the m/n clock generator of the vcxo clockconfigured through gpcr, the clcok is output to vcxo_out pad func3 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_AP_FUART349
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional fast uart clock output (58.5 mhz) of the main to the application processor apb portion. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_52M350
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 52 mhz clock output for apb peripherals 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_AP_TWSI351
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the 32m clock of the functional twsi clock output of the main to the application processor apb portion. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_208M352
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 208 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_26M353
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 26 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_13M354
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 13 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_6.5M355
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 6.5 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_AP_SUART356
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional m/n slow uart clock output (configured through succr) of the main to the application processor apb portion. it's just uart slow clock(14.17m) source enable 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_CLK_416M357
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable the functional 416 mhz clock output. 0 = clock not enabled 1 = clock enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SWR366
spirit:field.spirit:description: software controlled, reset events tracking field. this field may be written (and read) to any value between 0x0 and 0xf. this field's content does not affect functionality in any way

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_WDTR368
spirit:field.spirit:description: indicates whether the last system reset was caused by a watchdog timer reset event 0 = last system reset was not caused by watchdog timer reset 1 = last system reset was caused by watchdog timer reset depending on the type of reset the device has experienced, one of the reset values in [2:0] is 1 and the others are 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_EMR369
spirit:field.spirit:description: indicates whether the last system reset was caused by an external master reset event 0 = last system reset was not caused by external master reset 1 = last system reset was caused by external master reset depending on the type of reset the device has experienced, one of the reset values in [2:0] is 1 and the others are 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_POR370
spirit:field.spirit:description: indicates whether the last system reset was caused by a power on reset event 0 = last system reset was not caused by power on reset 1 = last system reset was caused by power on reset depending on the type of reset the device has experienced, one of the reset values in [2:0] is 1 and the others are 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PWRMODE_STATUS377
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field indicates that the system has entered and exited which state. one bit for one low power mode. if set to 1 indicate the low power mode has occured. it is cleared by set 1 to approprate bit of clr_pwrmode_status bit0 for d1p mode bit1 for d1pp mode bit2 for d1 mode bit3 for d2 mode bit 4 for d2p bit5 for d2pp mode bit6 for cluster0 m2 bit7 for cluster1 m2

spirit:field.spirit:name: PWRMODE_STATUS378
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field indicates that the system has entered and exited which state. one bit for one low power mode. if set to 1 indicate the low power mode has occured. it is cleared by set 1 to approprate bit of clr_pwrmode_status bit0 for d1p mode bit1 for d1pp mode bit2 for d1 mode bit3 for d2 mode bit 4 for d2p bit5 for d2pp mode bit6 for cluster0 m2 bit7 for cluster1 m2 bit8 for cluster2 m2

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLR_PWRMODE_STATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: clear power mode status. set 1 to cleare approprate of pwrmode_status bit.

spirit:register.spirit:name: AWUCRS

spirit:field.spirit:name: APB_52M
spirit:field.spirit:description: system apb clk source selection 0 = clock is 26 mhz 1 = clock is 52 mhz

spirit:register.spirit:name: AWUCRS1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Wakeup and Clock Resume Lines Status Register1

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_AP_GT_WAKEUP472
spirit:field.spirit:description: ap generic timer wakeup status

spirit:field.spirit:name: BYPASS_SH_INT0
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit used to select the interrupt source for sensor hub int0 0: from gpio74 interrupt 1:from pmic interrupt

spirit:field.spirit:name: SGADDRMAPEN481
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit control the interrupt trigger type for pmic to audio island 0:high level trigger 1:low level trigger

spirit:field.spirit:name: EN_PMIC_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0:disable 1:enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: GPIO_OUT_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: bit[23:16] control the out put source for gpio81,80,79,78,65,66,65,62,61 0:from ap 1:from gpo of audio island

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: bit[15:8] control the interrupt enable for gpio81~gpio74 . 0:disable 1:enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_TYPE
spirit:field.spirit:description: bit[7:0] control the interrupt trigger type for gpio81~gpio74 . 0:high level trigger 1:low level trigger

spirit:field.spirit:name: SGADDRMAPEN493
spirit:field.spirit:description: seagull address map enable 1=enable 0=disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: SGADDRMAPTG
spirit:field.spirit:description: seagull address map target address. if seagull address map enable and seagull write to 0xffff003f to 0xffffffff and seagull read from 0xffff0000 to 0xffffffff, the high 16bit address will use sgaddrmaptg.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSAADDRMAPEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: msa address map enable 1=enable 0=disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSAADDRMAPTG
spirit:field.spirit:description: msa address map target address. if msa address map enable and msa write/read address in the range from 0xd2000000 to 0xd3ffffff, msa address high 7bit will use msaaddrmaptg

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_GSRAM_WTC511
spirit:field.spirit:description: grayback gsram wtc

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_GSRAM_RTC512
spirit:field.spirit:description: grayback gsram rtc

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_GSRAM_ROM_RTC_REF513
spirit:field.spirit:description: grayback l2 rom rtc ref

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_GSRAM_ROM_RTC514
spirit:field.spirit:description: grayback l2 rom rtc

spirit:field.spirit:name: PMU2GB_WAKEUP_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mask for pmu2gb_wakeup signal: 1 = not masked; 0 = masked

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSA_L1_PDLVMC
spirit:field.spirit:description: gb l1 memory pdlvmc

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSA_L1_PDFVSSM
spirit:field.spirit:description: gb l1 memory pdfvssm

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSA_L1_RTC_SACMEM
spirit:field.spirit:description: gb l1 memory rtc

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSA_L1_WTC_SACMEM
spirit:field.spirit:description: gb l1 memory wtc

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSA_TRANSACTION_FIX
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0 = gb wrap transaction fix enable; 1 = old implementation

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSA_AIB_GB_L2_RATIO
spirit:field.spirit:description: aib gb l2 sram clock ratio

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSA_AIB_GB_L2_LATENCY
spirit:field.spirit:description: aib gb l2 sram latency

spirit:register.spirit:name: APCR_CLUSTER0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Marvell <var Processor: Application MP> Cluster 0 Power Control Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_AXISDD538
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow axi bus and agents to be shut down after marvell <var processor: comm>/ <var processor: application> cores enters idle state. 0 = axi shutdown not allowed 1 = axi shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSPSD539
spirit:field.spirit:description: not used

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPEN540
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to switch the system to sleep mode once it reached system idle mode. 0 = sleep mode not allowed 1 = sleep mode allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DDRCORSD542
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown. the clocks are halted when cpcr[ddrcorsd], apcr[ddrcorsd] & dpcr[ddrcorsd] are set and marvell <var processor: application mp> core is in idle mode 0 = marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown not allowed 1 = marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_APBSD543
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to shut down apb clock to all of its recipients, overriding other per-module fields. the apb clock is actually shut down once the marvell <var processor: comm>/ <var processor: application> cores are idle and cpcr[apbsd], apcr[apbsd] & dpcr[apbsd] are set 0 = apb clock shutdown not allowed 1 = apb clock shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_BBSD544
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to shut down all clocks provided to the baseband logic, except 32.768 khz clock. the baseband logic clocks are halted as soon as cpcr[bbsd], apcr[bbsd] & dpcr[bbsd] are set and pm_bb_clkres port is negated. 0 = bb clocks shutdown not allowed 1 = bb clocks shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_VCTCXOSD546
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow vctcxo shutdown when system is in sleep mode. vctcxo is shutdown when cpcr[vctcxosd], apcr[vctcxosd] & dpcr[vctcxosd] are set & the system enters sleep mode 0 = vctcxo shutdown not allowed 1 = vctcxo shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_MSASLPEN548
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow msa to switch msa subsystem to sleep mode once it reached msa sub system idle mode.the sleep mode is allowed when cpcr[msaslpen], apcr[msaslpen] & dpcr[msaslpen] 0 = msa sleep mode not allowed 1 = msa sleep mode allowed base on the cpmu setting, msa subsystem may be powered down.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_STBYEN549
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow apps subsystem to shutdown and go into udr-mode when ap subsystem is in sleep mode. udr is enabled when cpcr[stbyen], apcr[stbyen] are both set & ap subsystem enters ap sleep.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LDMA_MASK551
spirit:field.spirit:description: ldma mask this field is used to mask the lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown. 0 = lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown enabled 1 = lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown not allowed

spirit:register.spirit:name: APCR_CLUSTER1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Marvell <var Processor: Application MP> Cluster 1 Power Control Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_AXISDD560
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow axi bus and agents to be shut down after marvell <var processor: comm>/ <var processor: application> cores enters idle state. 0 = axi shutdown not allowed 1 = axi shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSPSD561
spirit:field.spirit:description: not used

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPEN562
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to switch the system to sleep mode once it reached system idle mode. 0 = sleep mode not allowed 1 = sleep mode allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DDRCORSD564
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown. the clocks are halted when cpcr[ddrcorsd], apcr[ddrcorsd] & dpcr[ddrcorsd] are set and marvell <var processor: application mp> core is in idle mode 0 = marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown not allowed 1 = marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_APBSD565
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to shut down apb clock to all of its recipients, overriding other per-module fields. the apb clock is actually shut down once the marvell <var processor: comm>/ <var processor: application> cores are idle and cpcr[apbsd], apcr[apbsd] & dpcr[apbsd] are set 0 = apb clock shutdown not allowed 1 = apb clock shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_BBSD566
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to shut down all clocks provided to the baseband logic, except 32.768 khz clock. the baseband logic clocks are halted as soon as cpcr[bbsd], apcr[bbsd] & dpcr[bbsd] are set and pm_bb_clkres port is negated. 0 = bb clocks shutdown not allowed 1 = bb clocks shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_VCTCXOSD568
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow vctcxo shutdown when system is in sleep mode. vctcxo is shutdown when cpcr[vctcxosd], apcr[vctcxosd] & dpcr[vctcxosd] are set & the system enters sleep mode 0 = vctcxo shutdown not allowed 1 = vctcxo shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_MSASLPEN570
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow msa to switch msa subsystem to sleep mode once it reached msa sub system idle mode.the sleep mode is allowed when cpcr[msaslpen], apcr[msaslpen] & dpcr[msaslpen] 0 = msa sleep mode not allowed 1 = msa sleep mode allowed base on the cpmu setting, msa subsystem may be powered down.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_STBYEN571
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow apps subsystem to shutdown and go into udr-mode when ap subsystem is in sleep mode. udr is enabled when cpcr[stbyen], apcr[stbyen] are both set & ap subsystem enters ap sleep.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LDMA_MASK573
spirit:field.spirit:description: ldma mask this field is used to mask the lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown. 0 = lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown enabled 1 = lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown not allowed

spirit:register.spirit:name: APCR_CLUSTER2
spirit:register.spirit:description: Marvell <var Processor: Application MP> Cluster 2 Power Control Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_AXISDD583
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow axi bus and agents to be shut down after marvell <var processor: comm>/ <var processor: application> cores enters idle state. 0 = axi shutdown not allowed 1 = axi shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSPSD584
spirit:field.spirit:description: not used

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPEN585
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to switch the system to sleep mode once it reached system idle mode. 0 = sleep mode not allowed 1 = sleep mode allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DDRCORSD587
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown. the clocks are halted when cpcr[ddrcorsd], apcr[ddrcorsd] & dpcr[ddrcorsd] are set and marvell <var processor: application mp> core is in idle mode 0 = marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown not allowed 1 = marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_APBSD588
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to shut down apb clock to all of its recipients, overriding other per-module fields. the apb clock is actually shut down once the marvell <var processor: comm>/ <var processor: application> cores are idle and cpcr[apbsd], apcr[apbsd] & dpcr[apbsd] are set 0 = apb clock shutdown not allowed 1 = apb clock shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_BBSD589
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to shut down all clocks provided to the baseband logic, except 32.768 khz clock. the baseband logic clocks are halted as soon as cpcr[bbsd], apcr[bbsd] & dpcr[bbsd] are set and pm_bb_clkres port is negated. 0 = bb clocks shutdown not allowed 1 = bb clocks shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_VCTCXOSD591
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow vctcxo shutdown when system is in sleep mode. vctcxo is shutdown when cpcr[vctcxosd], apcr[vctcxosd] & dpcr[vctcxosd] are set & the system enters sleep mode 0 = vctcxo shutdown not allowed 1 = vctcxo shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_MSASLPEN593
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow msa to switch msa subsystem to sleep mode once it reached msa sub system idle mode.the sleep mode is allowed when cpcr[msaslpen], apcr[msaslpen] & dpcr[msaslpen] 0 = msa sleep mode not allowed 1 = msa sleep mode allowed base on the cpmu setting, msa subsystem may be powered down.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_STBYEN594
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow apps subsystem to shutdown and go into udr-mode when ap subsystem is in sleep mode. udr is enabled when cpcr[stbyen], apcr[stbyen] are both set & ap subsystem enters ap sleep.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LDMA_MASK596
spirit:field.spirit:description: ldma mask this field is used to mask the lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown. 0 = lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown enabled 1 = lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown not allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_AXISDD606
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow axi bus and agents to be shut down after marvell <var processor: comm>/ <var processor: application> cores enters idle state. 0 = axi shutdown not allowed 1 = axi shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DSPSD607
spirit:field.spirit:description: not used

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_SLPEN608
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to switch the system to sleep mode once it reached system idle mode. 0 = sleep mode not allowed 1 = sleep mode allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_DDRCORSD610
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown. the clocks are halted when cpcr[ddrcorsd], apcr[ddrcorsd] & dpcr[ddrcorsd] are set and marvell <var processor: application mp> core is in idle mode 0 = marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown not allowed 1 = marvell <var processor: comm>/<var processor: application mp> core and tc ddr clocks shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_APBSD611
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to shut down apb clock to all of its recipients, overriding other per-module fields. the apb clock is actually shut down once the marvell <var processor: comm>/ <var processor: application> cores are idle and cpcr[apbsd], apcr[apbsd] & dpcr[apbsd] are set 0 = apb clock shutdown not allowed 1 = apb clock shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_BBSD612
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow pmu to shut down all clocks provided to the baseband logic, except 32.768 khz clock. the baseband logic clocks are halted as soon as cpcr[bbsd], apcr[bbsd] & dpcr[bbsd] are set and pm_bb_clkres port is negated. 0 = bb clocks shutdown not allowed 1 = bb clocks shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_VCTCXOSD614
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow vctcxo shutdown when system is in sleep mode. vctcxo is shutdown when cpcr[vctcxosd], apcr[vctcxosd] & dpcr[vctcxosd] are set & the system enters sleep mode 0 = vctcxo shutdown not allowed 1 = vctcxo shutdown allowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_MSASLPEN616
spirit:field.spirit:description: allow msa to switch msa subsystem to sleep mode once it reached msa sub system idle mode.the sleep mode is allowed when cpcr[msaslpen], apcr[msaslpen] & dpcr[msaslpen] 0 = msa sleep mode not allowed 1 = msa sleep mode allowed base on the cpmu setting, msa subsystem may be powered down.

spirit:field.spirit:description: allow apps subsystem to shutdown and go into udr-mode when ap subsystem is in sleep mode. udr is enabled when cpcr[stbyen], apcr[stbyen] are both set & ap subsystem enters ap sleep.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LDMA_MASK619
spirit:field.spirit:description: ldma mask this field is used to mask the lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown. 0 = lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown enabled 1 = lte dma hardware voting for ddr shutdown not allowed

spirit:register.spirit:name: SPRR
spirit:register.spirit:description: Marvell Secure Core Programmable Reset Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: WDTRST
spirit:field.spirit:description: system hot reset when this field is set to 1, it equals a watchdog reset event and watchdog reset generated. this field can only be write with a value of 1. writes of 0 are ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_WDTR631
spirit:field.spirit:description: negate hardware reset to wdt after system reset this field is reset due to a wdt reset event reading 0 = wdt reset is still asserted from the last system reset reading 1 = wdt reset is negated writing 0 = operation is ignored writing 1 = negates the wdt reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPR
spirit:field.spirit:description: this is read only bit - sp_wf_fuse 0 = secure core was not boot core 1 = secure core was the first core to boot

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAI_APR635
spirit:field.spirit:description: apply hardware reset to application processor 1 = core is held in reset. 0 = core is released from reset the initial value of this bit is determined by sp_wf_fuse_not. sp_wf_fuse = 1 (secure core is not first one to boot). sp_wf_fuse is 0 when secure core is boot core.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LRME
spirit:field.spirit:description: lte ddr remap enable 0 = lte ddr remap disabled 1 = lte ddr remap enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: LRMADDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: lte ddr remap address. when lte ddr remap is enabled, lte ddr address [32:28] is replaced with lrmaddr[4:0] in this field

spirit:field.spirit:name: CRME
spirit:field.spirit:description: cr7 ddr remap enable 0 = cr7 ddr remap disabled 1 = cr7 ddr remap enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CRMADDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: cr7 ddr remap address. when cr7 ddr remap is enabled, cr7 ddr address [32:28] is replaced with crmaddr[4:0] in this field
